SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Ball
Represents a ball in the game, characterized by its speed, direction, and behavior upon collisions.
BallManager
Manages the ball's movement and collision detection in a separate thread.
GameController
Manages the logic and state transitions of a game, including moving the ball, detecting collisions, and keeping score.
GameControllerTest
Tests for the GameController class that cover collision detection and response handling.
GameState
Represents the state of the game, including the dimensions of the play area, the players, the ball, and the winning score necessary to end the game.
GameView
Renders the visual representation of the game state on a canvas.
KeyboardListener
Handles keyboard input for controlling paddle movement, pausing, and restarting the game.
MenuController
Handles the configuration of game settings from the menu, updating the GameState based on user inputs.
MenuView
Constructs the main menu for the game, allowing players to input settings such as player names, paddle dimensions, ball characteristics, and the winning score.
Paddle
Represents a paddle in the game.
Player
Represents a player in the game, including their score, name, and paddle control.
Pong
The main class for the Pong game application.
Resizable
Provides an interface for game elements that can be resized along the X and Y axes.
